name: Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A hearty Italian classic made with ground beef and rich tomato sauce.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onions until translucent.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in canned tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve sauce over spaghetti and top with Parmesan cheese.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
description: A quick and healthy mix of vegetables stir-fried in a savory sauce.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger and stir for 30 seconds.
Add vegetables and stir fry for 5–7 minutes.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss to coat evenly.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: A fresh Caesar salad topped with grilled chicken and homemade dressing.
instructions: Grill or pan-fry the chicken breasts until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, Parmesan, and croutons.
Add Caesar dressing and toss well.
Top with sliced chicken and serve.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic soft and chewy cookies filled with chocolate chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream together butter and sugars until smooth.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
In another bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, then stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes.

name: Quinoa Salad
description: A light and nutritious salad made with quinoa and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook in water according to package instructions. Let cool.
Combine quinoa, cucumber, tomato, and red onion in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Toss well and chill before serving.

Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in canned tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve sauce over spaghetti and top with Parmesan cheese.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
description: A quick and healthy mix of vegetables stir-fried in a savory sauce.
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger and stir for 30 seconds.
Add vegetables and stir fry for 5–7 minutes.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss to coat evenly.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: A fresh Caesar salad topped with grilled chicken and homemade dressing.
instructions: Grill or pan-fry the chicken breasts until fully cooked. Slice into strips.

Add Caesar dressing and toss well.
Top with sliced chicken and serve.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic soft and chewy cookies filled with chocolate chips.

Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes.

Add garlic and ginger and stir for 30 seconds.
Add vegetables and stir fry for 5–7 minutes.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss to coat evenly.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: A fresh Caesar salad topped with grilled chicken and homemade dressing.
instructions: Grill or pan-fry the chicken breasts until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, Parmesan, and croutons.
Add Caesar dressing and toss well.
Top with sliced chicken and serve.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic soft and chewy cookies filled with chocolate chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream together butter and sugars until smooth.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
In another bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, then stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes.

name: Quinoa Salad
description: A light and nutritious salad made with quinoa and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook in water according to package instructions. Let cool.
Combine quinoa, cucumber, tomato, and red onion in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Toss well and chill before serving.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A hearty Italian classic made with ground beef and rich tomato sauce.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onions until translucent.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in canned tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve sauce over spaghetti and top with Parmesan cheese.

Add vegetables and stir fry for 5–7 minutes.
Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss to coat evenly.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: A fresh Caesar salad topped with grilled chicken and homemade dressing.
instructions: Grill or pan-fry the chicken breasts until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, Parmesan, and croutons.
Add Caesar dressing and toss well.
Top with sliced chicken and serve.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic soft and chewy cookies filled with chocolate chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream together butter and sugars until smooth.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
In another bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, then stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake for 10–12 minutes.

name: Quinoa Salad
description: A light and nutritious salad made with quinoa and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook in water according to package instructions. Let cool.
Combine quinoa, cucumber, tomato, and red onion in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Toss well and chill before serving.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A hearty Italian classic made with ground beef and rich tomato sauce.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onions until translucent.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in canned tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve sauce over spaghetti and top with Parmesan cheese.
